description: The function 'draw_decimal_grid' generates a visual representation of decimal numbers using a grid system. It creates grids divided into either 10 or 100 equal parts, with a certain number of parts shaded to represent a decimal or fraction. The grids are used for educational purposes, particularly for teaching decimal representation and fraction-to-decimal conversion.

stimulus_type_specification.title: Available Images: Decimal Grids
stimulus_type_specification.description: The 'draw_decimal_grid' function can generate images of decimal grids, which are grids divided into either 10 or 100 equal parts. The grids are shaded to represent a particular decimal or fraction. The function accepts two inputs: 'division', which determines how many parts the grid is divided into, and 'shaded_squares', which specifies the number of squares to shade. The function can create multiple grids if the number of shaded squares exceeds the division value, up to a maximum of 10 fully shaded grids. These visualizations are useful for teaching decimal representation and fraction-to-decimal conversion.

details: 'division': Determines the number of equal parts the grid is divided into. Must be either 10 or 100.
'shaded_squares': Specifies the number of squares to shade in the grid. Can exceed the division value to create multiple grids, up to a maximum of 10 fully shaded grids.
The 'division' value must be either 10 or 100.
The 'shaded_squares' value must be non-negative and cannot exceed the maximum allowed, which is the division value multiplied by 10.
The function draws grids divided into either 10 or 100 equal parts, with a certain number of parts shaded.
The function can create multiple grids if the number of shaded squares exceeds the division value, up to a maximum of 10 fully shaded grids.
The grids are arranged in rows, with a maximum of 5 grids per row.

educational_standards.description: Find decimals that are greater than or less than decimals represented on grids.
